conbody.p:
Jython Evaluator processorscripting objectsscripting objectsJython EvaluatorYou can use the following scripting objects in the Jython Evaluator:port changes over to JavaScript Scripting Objects
records array An array of records to process. The records object includes different elements based on the processing mode that you use:
Record by Record - The records array includes one record element.
Batch by Batch - The records array includes all records in the batch.
record An object that represents a single record. Includes a single value element. The value element contains the data for the record. Map and list record fields are mapped to Jython dictionaries and lists, respectively. Data types are preserved for values that are not modified. For values that are modified, the scripting engine might change the original type.
log An object to write messages to the log. Includes four methods: info(), warn(), debug(), and trace(). The signature of the 4 methods is as follows: (message-template, argumentsâ€¦) The message template can have positional variables denoted by curly brackets: { }. The arguments are replaced in the message template curly brackets in positional manner, i.e., this is the first argument in the first { } occurrence, and so on.
out An object that writes the record to the output batch. Includes a write(Record) method.
err An object that passes error records to the processor for error handling. Includes a write(Record, message) method.
